sentences: Samal päeval saime meil rõõmsaks sündmuseks.
Ta tuli samal ajal koos oma sõpradega.
Meie koolis on samal päeval mitu kontserti.
context: The Estonian word 'samal' is an adessive case form of the adjective 'sama', meaning 'same'. It is used with the genitive or partitive case to indicate that something happens or exists at the same time as something else. The structure 'samal + case' translates to English phrases like 'on the same [noun]' or 'at the same time'. For example, 'samal päeval' means 'on the same day', and 'samal ajal' means 'at the same time'.
